variant.question:
Refer to figure.

Select the correct option regarding NOTAM A1557/14:

options.text: The coordinates are from each crane and the cranes are 160 ft MSL.
The cranes form an H pattern (according to their coordinates).
The coordinates provided make up a zone where cranes are within.
The coordinates are for each crane.

variant.question:
What does the message “EGNOS IS NOT AVAILABLE FOR LPV” of the following NOTAM indicate?

Q) LSAS/QGAAU/I/NBO/A/000/999/4729N00933E005   
 A) LSZR B) 1401071300 C) 1401071458   
 E) EGNOS IS NOT AVAILABLE FOR LPV.

options.text: ABAS is unavailable for approaches to LPV minima.
ABAS is unavailable for all approaches.
SBAS is unavailable for RNAV approaches to LNAV minima.
SBAS is unavailable for approaches to LPV minima.

variant.question: Where can you check GNSS availability?

options.text: ATIS
SBAS
NANU
AIP

variant.question: A NANU is an advisory message to inform users of a change in the (1) \_\_ constellation. These messages are released 72 hours in advance for (2) \_\_.

options.text: (1) GLONASS; (2) planned maintenance
(1) GPS; (2) planned maintenance
(1) GPS; (2) selected users
(1) GLONASS; (2) selected users

variant.question:
Consider the following NOTAM. When within the reduced range, what service might NOT be available from Kirkwall during the validity period?

Q EGPX/QCAAS/IV/B/AE/000/021/5857N00254W002   
A EGPA   
B FROM: 15/12/30 17:29   
C TO: 16/01/31 19:45   
E KIRKWALL MAIN VHF TRANSMITTER 118.3 MHZ WITHDRAWN FROM SERVICE DUE FAULT. STANDBY TRANSMITTER IN USE WITH REDUCED RANGE AND COVERAGE.

options.text: VDF
VOR
ILS
ATC clearances

variant.question:
Given the following NOTAM information, what changes apply to NDB CF?

NEW TODAY TIL 1603312359 NDB REMAINS CF 367KHZ FROM 0000 TO 0900 NDB CF 367KHZ BECOMES ASM 367KHZ FROM 0900 TO 2359 REF TRIGGER NOTAM PERM AIRAC AIP AMDT 04/16 : NOTAM LF/F0403/16 >>> END OF BULLETIN <<<

options.text: NDB CF identifier changes from “CF” to “ASM” at 23:59 UTC on the given date.
NDB CF identifier changes from “CF” to “ASM” at 09:00 UTC on the given date.
NDB CF frequency changes to 367 kHz at 09:00 UTC on the given date.
NDB CF identifier changes to “ASM” at 09:00 UTC, and changes back to “CF” after 00:00 UTC.

variant.question:
What does the following NOTAM indicate?

Q EUAD/QOLAS/IV/M/E/000/004/5626N00214W001 A EUAD B FROM: 26 Jan 2016 17:32C TO: 26 Feb 2016 23:59 E AIR NAV OBST UK0150J492F BLDG INCH CAPE O/S MET MAST SINGLE LGT U/S, PSN 562624.274N 0021429.366W, ELEV 381FT AMSL

options.text: A building has been removed.
A lighted mast has been placed on a building.
An obstacle light is unserviceable.
A building has been put in place.

variant.question: A NOTAM shall be originated and issued concerning which of the following info?

options.text: The unserviceability of location, destination or other instruction signs on the aerodrome movement area.
The lack of apron marshalling services and road traffic control.
The occurence or correction of major defects or impediements in the maneuvering area.
Routine maintenance work on aprons and the taxiways that doesnt affect the safe movement on air.

variant.question: What is the difference between GNSS planned and unplanned outages?

options.text: Unplanned outages are NOT notified.
Planned outages are not notified.
Unplanned outages are notified weekly.
Planned outages are notified in advance.

variant.question:
What should be considered when using the following NOTAM information from the transmitter during the validity period?

Q) EDGG/QNNCS/IV/BO/AE/000/999/5049N00638E025 A) ETNN B) FROM: 15/11/11 09:00 C) TO: 16/02/10 21:50 EST E) AD ETNN: MOBILE TACAN NOE CH79Y IN USE. PSN 504947N0063847E 259DEG 859M FROM ARP.

options.text: An approach to the ARP is possible by following the 259 degree radial.
The slant range indications are only valid for the position indicated.
The distance indications have to be adjusted by 859 metres.
The transmitter may move from the position indicated.

variant.question: In a NOTAM, what does the abbreviation “LO” indicate?

options.text: Low (e.g. low intensity)
Lighted obstacle
Locator
Limited operation
